00038         // Takes one parameter defining the backtitle of the application (will be on the top of screen for all Dialog windows)
00039 
00040         UString output;
00041 
00042         UDialog(const char* _backtitle = 0, int _height = 0, int _width = 0)
00043                         : output(U_CAPACITY), backtitle(_backtitle), command(U_CAPACITY), argument(U_CAPACITY)
00044                 {
00045                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UDialog, "%S,%d,%d", _backtitle, _height, _width)
00046 
00047                 width  = _width;
00048                 height = _height;
00049 
00050                 if (path_dialog == 0) initialize();
00051                 }
00052 
00053         ~UDialog()
00054                 {
00055                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UDialog)
00056                 }
00057 
00058         // SERVICES: calendar, checklist, fselect, gauge, infobox, inputbox, inputmenu, menu, msgbox (message),
00059         //                               password, radiolist, tailbox, tailboxbg, textbox, timebox, and yesno (yes/no)...
00060 
00061         static bool isXdialog()
00062                 {
00063                 U_TRACE(0, "UDialog::isXdialog()")
00064 
00065                 U_RETURN(xdialog);
00066                 }
00067 
00068         void setSize(int _height = 0, int _width = 0)
00069                 {
00070                 U_TRACE(0, "UDialog::setSize(%d,%d)", _height, _width)
00071 
00072                 width  = _width;
00073                 height = _height;
00074                 }

00077                 {
00078                 U_TRACE(0, "UDialog::setOptions(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(opt))

00080                 options = opt;

00090         bool run(const char* title, const char* format, ...);
00091 
00092         // A password box is similar to an input box, except that the text the user enters is not displayed.
00093 
00094         bool passwordbox(const char* text, UString& init, const char* title = 0);
00095 
00096         // Display a list of items as a series of checkboxes.
00097         // The array selected defines default values (any objects which appear in the list are checked).
00098 
00099         void checklist(const char* text, const char* tags[], const char* items[], bool selected[], int list_height = 0, const char* title = 0);
00100 
00101         // Display a list of items as a series of radioboxes. The param select defines default values.
00102         // Will return the numerical index of item selected.
00103 
00104         int radiolist(const char* text, const char* tags[],
00105                                           const char* items[], int select = 0, int list_height = 0, const char* title = 0);
00106 
00107         // Display a yesno box prompting user with a question. Returns true if the user selects yes or false otherwise
00108 
00109         bool yesno(const char* text, const char* title = 0) { return run(title, "--yesno \"%s\" %d %d", text, height, width); }
00110 
00111         // Display a simple message box on the screen
00112 
00113         void msgbox(const char* text, const char* title = 0) { (void) run(title, "--msgbox \"%s\" %d %d", text, height, width); }
00114 
00115         // An info box is basically a message box. However, in this  case, dialog will exit immediately after displaying
00116         // the message to the user. The screen is not cleared when dialog exits, so that the message will remain on the screen
00117 
00118         void infobox(const char* text, const char* title = 0) { (void) run(title, "--infobox \"%s\" %d %d", text, height, width); }
00119 
00120         // Display a given file in a textbox
00121 
00122         void textbox(const char* file, const char* title = 0) { (void) run((title ? title : file), "--textbox \"%s\" %d %d", file, height, width); }
00123 
00124         // file selector dialog
00125 
00126         bool fselect(UString& filepath, const char* title = 0);
00127 
00128         // Display text from a file in a dialog box, as in a "tail -f" command.
00129 
00130         void tailbox(const char* file, const char* title = 0) { (void) run(title, "--tailbox \"%s\" %d %d", file, height, width); }
00131 
00132         // Display a menu from a list of items. Will return the numerical index of item selected
00133 
00134         int  menu(const char* text, const char* tags[], const char* items[], int list_height = 0, const char* title = 0);
00135         bool menu(const char* text, UVector<UString>& list, UString& choice, int list_height = 0, const char* title = 0);
00136 
00137         // Display a input box with a text prompt given an initial string
00138 
00139         bool inputbox(const char* text, UString& init, const char* title = 0);

00141         // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142         // NB: specific for Xdialog
00143         // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00144 
00145         // The --2inputsbox and the --3inputsbox widgets allow for two or three entry fields into the same box. A <label> is setup above each field
00146         // (see the --center, --left, --right and --fill common options to learn how the labels justification and alignement can be affected); as for
00147         // the <text> parameter, the <label>s may hold "\n" sequences IOT force text splitting into several lines. The <init> strings cannot be omitted
00148         // but may perfectly be NULL (empty) strings.
00149 
00150         bool inputsbox2(const char* text, const char* labels[], UVector<UString>& init, const char* title = 0) { return inputsbox(2,text,labels,init,title); }
00151         bool inputsbox3(const char* text, const char* labels[], UVector<UString>& init, const char* title = 0) { return inputsbox(3,text,labels,init,title); }
00152 
00153         // The combobox displays a <text> together with an entry field to which a pull-down list of <items> is attached,
00154         // returns the entry field contents once the OK button is pressed
00155 
00156         bool combobox(const char* text, UVector<UString>& list, UString& choice, const char* title = 0);
00157 
00158         // Display a tree box on the screen
00159 
00160         int tree(const char* text, const char* items[], uint32_t items_depth[], const char* item_tags[] = 0,
00161                                 const char* items_status[] = 0, const char* items_help[] = 0, int list_height = 0, const char* title = 0);

00188 /*
00189    # Here is the guage code. It will keep a process identifier open, so
00190    # that in the future we can update it. this means that the user has to
00191    # take care of storing the returned object.
00192 
00193    def guage(title, text, height=20, width=70, percent=0, num_step=0)
00194       checkHW(height, width)
00195 
00196       if num_step > 0
00197       #  if num_step > 100
00198       #  else
00199             @inc2 = 100.0 / num_step
00200             @inc1 = @inc2 + 1.0
00201 
00202             # -------------------------------------------------------------
00203             # sistema di 3 equazioni a 2 incognite
00204             # -------------------------------------------------------------
00205             # inc1  - inc2   = 1
00206             #     x +     y  = num_step
00207             # inc1x + inc2y  = 100
00208             # -------------------------------------------------------------
00209             # x              = 100 - inc2 * num_step
00210             # y              = num_step * inc1 - 100
00211             # soglia = inc1x = 100 - inc2 * ( num_step * inc1 - 100 )
00212             # -------------------------------------------------------------
00213 
00214             @soglia = 100.0 - @inc2 * (num_step * @inc1 - 100.0)
00215 
00216 #           puts "inc1 = #{@inc1} soglia = #{@soglia} inc2 = #{@inc2}"
00217 #           sleep 5
00218       #  end
00219       end
00220 
00221       @percent = percent
00222       options = "--backtitle '#{@title}'"
00223       guage_tmp = IO.popen("#{@DIALOG} --title '#{title}' #{options} --gauge '#{text}' #{height} #{width} #{percent}","w+")
00224 
00225       return guage_tmp
00226    end
00227 
00228    # update the guage passed in with the percentage
00229 
00230    def setguage(guage_tmp, percent, text)
00231       if percent > 100 then
00232          percent = 100
00233       elsif percent < 0 then
00234          if @percent < @soglia then
00235             @percent += @inc1
00236          else
00237             @percent += @inc2
00238          end
00239          percent = @percent
00240       end
00241 
00242       guage_tmp.puts <<-EOS
00243 XXX
00244 #{percent.to_i}
00245 \n#{text}
00246 XXX
00247       EOS
00248 
00249       if percent >= 100 then
00250          closeguage(guage_tmp)
00251       end
00252    end
00253 
00254    # If we want to close the guage (when it gets to 100% or jst for some
00255    # rather arbitrary reason) then we call this. sleep for a while as
00256    # well, jst so the user can actually see it reaching 100%
00257 
00258    def closeguage(guage_tmp)
00259       guage_tmp.puts <<-EOS
00260 XXX
00261 100
00262 \nDone
00263 XXX
00264       EOS
00265 
00266       sleep 2;
00267       guage_tmp.close
00268    end
00269 */
